required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Is Masseteric Nerve Block Effective in Myofascial Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Efficacy of Different Treatment Modalities in Masseteric Myofascial Pain: Masseteric Nerve Block, Local Anesthetic Injection and Dry-needling

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the present study was to compare the efficacy of three different treatment methods in the management of myofascial pain: masseteric nerve block (MN), trigger point injection(TrP) with local anesthetic (LA) and dry needling (DN).Study Design: 45 subjects aged 18-54 years were randomly assigned to the MN group (n= 15), LA group (n=15) and DN group (n=15).

detailed_description.textblock:
The study sample consisted 45 patients with masseter muscle originated myofascial pain, were selected in accordance with the following criteria:
Patients were grouped according to the treatment they received: dry-needling (DN), TrP injections with local anesthetic (LA) and masseteric nerve block (MNB). Localization of the masseteric trigger points (MTPs) was based on clinician's sense and patients' expressions of pain. Local twitch response was not observable in all case. This procedure was completed by using digital palpation (1.5 Kg), and the clinical examiner's palpation was calibrated using a pressure algometer.

primary_outcome.measure: The Rate of Pain on Function (PoF) assessed by Numerical pain Scale (NRS)
primary_outcome.description: Patients rated their pain on function (pain during chewing or speaking etc.) on a Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) (0-10 where 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst pain imaginable)

primary_outcome.measure: The Rate of Pain on Function (PoF) assessed by Numerical pain Scale (NRS)
primary_outcome.description: Patients rated their pain on function (pain during chewing or speaking etc.) on a Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) (0-10 where 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst pain imaginable)

primary_outcome.measure: The Rate of Pain on Function (PoF) assessed by Numerical pain Scale (NRS)
primary_outcome.description: Patients rated their pain on function (pain during chewing or speaking etc.) on a Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) (0-10 where 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst pain imaginable)

primary_outcome.measure: The Rate of Pain on Function (PoF) assessed by Numerical pain Scale (NRS)
primary_outcome.description: Patients rated their pain on function (pain during chewing or speaking etc.) on a Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) (0-10 where 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.measure: The Rate of Pain Intensity on Palpation (PoP)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients rated their pain intensity on masseter muscle by a 4-point Likert-type scale (0 = no pain, 3 = as worst pain imaginable) while a calibrated examiner palpating their masseter muscle.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Rate of Pain Intensity on Palpation (PoP)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients rated their pain intensity on masseter muscle by a 4-point Likert-type scale (0 = no pain, 3 = as worst pain imaginable) while a calibrated examiner palpating their masseter muscle.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Rate of Pain Intensity on Palpation (PoP)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients rated their pain intensity on masseter muscle by a 4-point Likert-type scale (0 = no pain, 3 = as worst pain imaginable) while a calibrated examiner palpating their masseter muscle.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Rate of Pain Intensity on Palpation (PoP)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients rated their pain intensity on masseter muscle by a 4-point Likert-type scale (0 = no pain, 3 = as worst pain imaginable) while a calibrated examiner palpating their masseter muscle.

secondary_outcome.measure: The measurement of pain-free maximum mouth opening (MMO) in millimeters
secondary_outcome.description: Pain-free MMO was measured as the distance between the incisal edges of the upper and lower incisors while patient's mouth is open as possible without any assistance and without pain in masseter muscle. Three measurements were performed, and their average is recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: The measurement of pain-free maximum mouth opening (MMO) in millimeters
secondary_outcome.description: Pain-free MMO was measured as the distance between the incisal edges of the upper and lower incisors while patient's mouth is open as possible without any assistance and without pain in masseter muscle. Three measurements were performed, and their average is recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: The measurement of pain-free maximum mouth opening (MMO) in millimeters
secondary_outcome.description: Pain-free MMO was measured as the distance between the incisal edges of the upper and lower incisors while patient's mouth is open as possible without any assistance and without pain in masseter muscle. Three measurements were performed, and their average is recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: The measurement of pain-free maximum mouth opening (MMO) in millimeters
secondary_outcome.description: Pain-free MMO was measured as the distance between the incisal edges of the upper and lower incisors while patient's mouth is open as possible without any assistance and without pain in masseter muscle. Three measurements were performed, and their average is recorded.

clinical_study.condition: Myofascial Pain - Dysfunction Syndrome of TMJ

arm_group.description: masseteric nerve block with local anesthesia lidocaine single app.

arm_group.arm_group_label: LA -trigger point injection with local anesthetic
arm_group.description: local anesthetic injections on trigger points in masseter

intervention.description: trigger point injection with local anesthetic
intervention.arm_group_label: LA -trigger point injection with local anesthetic

intervention.description: needling with acupuncture needles of trigger points in masseter

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of myofascial pain.
- Presence of at least one trigger point in masseter muscle.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Generalized muscle disorders.
- Hypersensitivity to local anesthetics.
